items.title: BBC News app
items.summary: Top stories, breaking news, live reporting, and follow news topics that match your interests

items.title: Trump administration launches immigration raids in Chicago
items.summary: The Illinois governor said no advance notice or coordination was provided; critics decry 'Operation Midway Blitz' as political theater

items.title: West Bengal Governor and Chief Minister shower Bengali filmmaker Anuparna Roy with appreciation for Venice win
items.summary: The Purulia born Bengali director gained praise for making history at a global platform

items.title: Morning Digest: Democrats release suggestive birthday letter to Epstein purportedly signed by Trump, which he denies; 19 killed in Nepal Gen Z protests sparked by social media ban, and more
items.summary: Here is a select list of stories to start the day

items.title: Bengaluru’s Blue Line of Namma Metro scheduled for completion by Dec. 2027
items.summary: According to Bangalore Metro Rail Corporation Limited, once completed, the Blue Line will form a 58.19-km uninterrupted corridor connecting Silk Board Junction in the south with the airport in the north via K.R. Pura.

Soyel attempting to burn a photograph of the poet along with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit

items.title: Supreme Court asks Madhya Pradesh government to pay ₹25 lakh to convict for over 4 years in jail beyond term
items.summary: Sohan Singh Yadav was only released from Sagar Central Jail on June 6 this year, after advocate Mahfooz A. Nazki wrote to the prison authorities and the M.P. State Legal Services Authority flagging the matter

items.title: Indian Army PARA (SF) and Indian Navy MARCOS conduct high-altitude combat diving training in Sikkim
items.summary: “Training in these extreme conditions tests every aspect of a soldier’s endurance, skill and mental strength,” the Team Commander said

items.title: 3 former BJP, AGP MLAs join Congress ahead of Assam Assembly polls
items.summary: Former BJP MLAs Binanda Saikia and Mansingh Rongpi, and AGP MLA Satyabrata Kalita, were inducted into the party in the presence of senior leaders, including Assam Congress chief Gaurav Gogoi

items.title: More than 60 injured, 10 killed after Mexican train hits double-decker bus
items.summary: The State of Mexico’s attorney general’s office said seven women and three men were killed

items.title: Enforcement Directorate raids in several locations in West Bengal, including Kolkata over sand smuggling racket
items.summary: Opposition parties accuse Trinamool Congress of being involved in the racket; TMC officials say these agency raids are a political move before the elections

items.title: Democrats release suggestive birthday letter to Epstein purportedly signed by Trump, which he denies
items.summary: Donald Trump has denied writing the letter and creating the drawing, calling a report on it “false, malicious, and defamatory”

items.title: India, China should counter unfair U.S. tariffs: Chinese envoy
items.summary: Xu Feihong said the U.S. is using the tariffs as a kind of “weapon” to extract “exorbitant” costs from various countries, and India and China must cooperate with each other to navigate the situation

items.title: Gulf Oil Corporation pays ₹20-lakh penalty for illegal tree felling

items.title: FTCCI hails GST tweaks, bats for bringing petrol and diesel under levy
items.summary: At present, the products are levied VAT/sales tax by State governments and the rates vary

items.title: After Nizam, successive Congress govts ensured drinking water supply for Hyderabad, says CM Revanth Reddy
items.summary: Foundation laid for Godavari Phase II & III at Gandipet to bring additional 17.5 tmc ft of water to Hyderabad, rejuvenate the Musi river and meet the city’s rising drinking water needs by 2027

items.title: Ofsted to bring in 'report card' school inspections despite criticism
items.summary: A new monitoring system will also be introduced, so schools can improve negative grades more quickly.

Instead, accompanied by a few police personnel, he was seen sprinting towards another vehicle. However, half-an-hour later, he emerged in a police vehicle and

items.title: Explains steps taken to check spy cameras’ misuse at malls, other places: HC to government

items.summary: PDP and NC parties say that those who took the decision to place the National Emblem on a plaque in a religious place should be held accountable and also demand withdrawal of FIR against locals

items.title: Revamp of GST structure will accelerate industrial growth, says Chairman of Puducherry chapter of CII
items.summary: In a message, Mr Kamra said the reforms initiated would bring the industry and consumers closer and further accelerate industrial development in the country.

items.title: It's taken three years to recover from China hack, election watchdog says
items.summary: In the first interview about the hack, the commission's new boss admits that huge mistakes were made, but says the organisation is now secure.

items.title: Vape ban isn't working, says waste firm boss
items.summary: Millions of vapes are being thrown away incorrectly despite the ban, causing chaos, says Biffa.

items.title: Svarnim Puducherry participates in national Changemakers’ meet in Gujarat
items.summary: Organised by the National Changemakers’ meet Network, Banas Dairy, and India Foundation from September 4 to 7, the gathering witnessed the participation of 51 changemakers from 27 States across the country

items.title: BJD, BRS, Akali Dal to abstain from vice-presidential election
items.summary: This will not impact electoral arithmetic that is leaning in favour of ruling party candidate C.P. Radhakrishnan; both sides conduct meetings and mock polls on election eve to ensure maximum attendance of their MPs; all eyes on Shiv Sena (UBT)

items.title: Bazball 'misconceptions' are 'disrespectful' - McCullum

items.title: Srushti Fertility Centre case: three government doctors placed under suspension

items.title: Leaders of INDIA bloc hold protest against power privatisation issue in U.T.
items.summary: The protest march, which began from Raja Theatre signal, was stopped by the police at Nehru Street-Mission Street junction before the leaders could proceed towards Raj Nivas.

items.title: Parliamentary panel to be briefed ahead of EU-India FTA talks
items.summary: Officials are expected to help build political consensus over FTA talks with European countries; EU trade negotiators are in Delhi for meetings, where both sides are expected to agree on an accelerated plan for talks every month

items.title: SC allows Medha Patkar to withdraw plea in defamation case against Delhi L-G
items.summary: Patkar’s counsel withdrew the plea after the top court declined to interfere with the Delhi High Court’s rejection of her request to examine an additional witness in a defamation case against Delhi L-G V. K. Saxena

items.title: Lokesh meets TDP MPs ahead of Vice-President election

items.summary: Scotland head coach Steve Clarke says he is "already thinking about next month" when his side face Greece at Hampden, after taking four points from two games in World Cup qualifying.

items.title: Economic practices must be fair, transparent: Jaishankar

items.title: Kerala to finalise urban policy at Kochi conclave

items.title: PM Modi to cast first vote in vice-presidential election

items.title: Murdochs reach deal in succession battle over media empire

items.title: Twenty20 moves HC against poll booth proposal at  mosque

items.title: Israel airstrikes kill five in northeastern Lebanon, including four Hezbollah members
items.summary: The Lebanese government recently backed a plan drafted by the military to gradually disarm the group, but said it opposes any direct confrontation with Hezbollah

items.summary: Watch highlights from Scotland's World Cup qualifying win over Belarus.

items.title: London's Tube network shuts as workers begin week of strikes

items.title: Japan has had three PMs in five years - who could be next?
items.summary: Japan's next leader will face the challenge of steering a much weakened government.

items.title: Supreme Court hears Kerala doctor’s petition on ‘brain-stem death’
items.summary: The Court said it could not be expected to legislate or ‘second-guess’ Parliament’s definition in the 1994 law on when ‘life ceases and death begins’

items.summary: The Father Ted writer tells the BBC he stands by his online posts which led to his arrest last week.
